Song.title: How Great Is Our God (Palm Sunday)
Song.copyright: “How Great Is Our God” words and music by Tomlin, Reeves, and Cash; alt. verses by Jon Bloom © 2004 worshiptogether.com songs/ sixsteps Music/ Alletrope Music.

Arrangement.text:
VERSE 1: Jer[G]usalem behold, as pr[Em7]ophecy foretold Your King of glory c[C2]omes, your King of glory comes He [G]rides in on a foal Your red[Em7]emption as his goal Your King of glory c[C2]omes, with mercy now he comes
CHORUS: How [G]great is our God! Sing with me: How [Em7]great is our God! And all will see how [Cmaj7]great, how g[D]reat is our G[G2]od!
VERSE 2: The [G]Son of God arrives, as the [Em7]Son of Man to die The crowd lifts up a sh[C2]out, “Hosanna, King!” they shout The c[G]hildren all rejoice! If [Em7]they would have no voice The rocks would all cry [C2]out, the rocks would all cry out,
BRIDGE: [G]Name above all names, [Em7]worthy of all praise My [Cmaj7]heart will sing: How g[D]reat is our [G]God
Arrangement.searchtext: verse 1 jerusalem behold as prophecy foretold your king of glory comes your king of glory comes he rides in on a foal your redemption as his goal your king of glory comes with mercy now he comes chorus how great is our god sing with me how great is our god and all will see how great how great is our god verse 2 the son of god arrives as the son of man to die the crowd lifts up a shout hosanna king they shout the children all rejoice if they would have no voice the rocks would all cry out the rocks would all cry out bridge name above all names worthy of all praise my heart will sing how great is our god
